Shinyhero36’s module¶

Assistant class¶

class flask_assistant.Assistant.Assistant(app=None, route=None, basic_auth_usr=None, basic_auth_pwd=None)¶

Bases: object

Flask Assistant helps linking your Google Assistant App with Flask via webhooks

Parameters

  • app (Flask) – a Flask application object

  • route (str) – Route at which your assistant will listen to.

  • basic_auth_usr (str, optional) – Username to use for basic auth

  • basic_auth_pwd (str, optional) – Password to use for basic auth

defaultResponse(f)¶

Register a default function which serve as a default response if no intent was mapped

Parameters

f (function) – A function

init_app(app, route=None, basic_auth_usr=None, basic_auth_pwd=None)¶

Initialize the flask object

Parameters

  • app (Flask) – a Flask application object

  • route (str) – Route at which your assistant will listen to.

  • basic_auth_usr (str, optional) – Username to use for basic auth

  • basic_auth_pwd (str, optional) – Password to use for basic auth

See also

Why an init_app function? See: https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.0.x/extensiondev/#flask-extension-development

onIntent(intentName)¶

Decorator which registers an actions’s view function

Parameters

intentName (str) – The name of the intent to map to a function

say(responses=None, suggestions=None, endConversation=False)¶

Generate the json response

Parameters

  • responses (list) – A list of rich responses

  • suggestions (list[SuggestionChip], optional) – A list of suggestion chips

  • endConversation (bool, optional) – Self explanatory

Warning

  • If the ‘responses’ parameter is empty, the app will crash

Returns

An understandable response for the assistant

Return type

dict

RichResponses module¶

class flask_assistant.RichResponses.SimpleResponse(tts=None, displayText=None)¶

Bases: object

Simple responses take the form of a chat bubble visually and use text-to-speech (TTS) or Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) for sound.

Parameters

  • tts (str) – the text to say out loud

  • displayText (str) – the text to display

Notes

TTS text is used as chat bubble content by default. If the visual aspect of that text meets your needs, you won’t need to specify any display text for a chat bubble.

class flask_assistant.RichResponses.SuggestionChip(text)¶

Bases: object

SuggestionChip takes the form of a bubble at the bottom of the screen.

Parameters

text (str) – The text to display on the chip
